pages.text: $(l:redstone/redstone_components#noteblock)$(item)Note Blocks$() play a musical note when hit or powered by $(l:redstone/redstone_behavior)$(item)Redstone$(). $(br2)A $(l:redstone/redstone_components#noteblock)$(item)Note Block$() must have air in the space directly above it to play a sound. $(br2)Pressing the use button on the block increases the note pitch up a semitone.
The tuning can also be checked by looking at the right side of the debug screen (pressing $(thing)F3$())

The instrument played depends on the material of the block underneath the $(thing)Note Block$(): $(br)$(li)$(l)Wood$() = Bass $(li)$(l)Sand/Gravel$() = Snare Drum $(li)$(l)Glass$() = Clicks & Sticks $(li)$(l)Stone type$() = Bass Drum $(li)$(l)Gold Block$() = Bells $(li)$(l)Clay/Honeycomp$() = Flute $(li)$(l)Packed Ice$() = Chimes $(li)$(l)Wool$() = Guitar $(li)$(l)Bone Block$() = Xylophone $(li)$(l)Iron Block$() = Iron Xylophone $(li)$(l)Soul Sand$() = Cow Bell

$(li)$(l)Pumpkin$() = Didgeridoo $(li)$(l)Emerald Block$() = Bit $(li)$(l)Hay Bale$() = Banjo $(li)$(l)Glowstone$() = Pling $(li)$(l)all other$() = Harp / piano $(br2)Placing a $(l:rare/mob_head)$(item)Head$() $(n)above$() a note block causes the block to play the corresponding mob's sound when activated.
